16.verse: And said, I have sworn by Myself, says the Lord, that since you have done this and have not withheld [from Me] or begrudged [giving Me] your son, your only son,

17.verse: In blessing I will bless you and in multiplying I will multiply your descendants like the stars of the heavens and like the sand on the seashore. And your Seed (Heir) will possess the gate of His enemies,

18.verse: And in your Seed [Christ] shall all the nations of the earth be blessed and [by Him] bless themselves, because you have heard and obeyed My voice.

19.verse: So Abraham returned to his servants, and they rose up and went with him to Beersheba; there Abraham lived.

20.verse: Now after these things, it was told Abraham, Milcah has also borne children to your brother Nahor:

21.verse: Uz the firstborn, Buz his brother, Kemuel the father of Aram,

22.verse: Chesed, Hazo, Pildash, Jidlaph, and Bethuel.

23.verse: Bethuel became the father of Rebekah. These eight Milcah bore to Nahor, Abraham's brother.

24.verse: And his concubine, whose name was Reumah, bore Tebah, Gaham, Tahash, and Maacah.

1.verse: SARAH LIVED 127 years; this was the length of the life of Sarah.

2.verse: And Sarah died in Kiriath-arba, that is, Hebron, in the land of Canaan. And Abraham went to mourn for Sarah and to weep for her.

3.verse: And Abraham stood up from before his dead and said to the sons of Heth,

4.verse: I am a stranger and a sojourner with you; give me property for a burial place among you, that I may bury my dead out of my sight.

5.verse: And the Hittites replied to Abraham,

6.verse: Listen to us, my lord; you are a mighty prince among us. Bury your dead in any tomb or grave of ours that you choose; none of us will withhold from you his tomb or hinder you from burying your dead.

7.verse: And Abraham stood up and bowed himself to the people of the land, the Hittites.

8.verse: And he said to them, If you are willing to grant my dead a burial out of my sight, listen to me and ask Ephron son of Zohar for me,

9.verse: That he may give me the cave of Machpelah, which he owns--it is at the end of his field. For the full price let him give it to me here in your presence as a burial place to which I may hold fast among you.

10.verse: Now Ephron was present there among the sons of Heth; so, in the hearing of all who went in at the gate of his city, Ephron the Hittite answered Abraham, saying,

11.verse: No, my lord, hear me; I give you the field, and the cave that is in it I give you. In the presence of the sons of my people I give it to you. Bury your dead.

12.verse: Then Abraham bowed himself down before the people of the land.

13.verse: And he said to Ephron in the presence of the people of the land, But if you will give it, I beg of you, hear me. I will give you the price of the field; accept it from me, and I will bury my dead there.

14.verse: Ephron replied to Abraham, saying,

15.verse: My lord, listen to me. The land is worth 400 shekels of silver; what is that between you and me? So bury your dead.

16.verse: So Abraham listened to what Ephron said and acted upon it. He weighed to Ephron the silver which he had named in the hearing of the Hittites: 400 shekels of silver, according to the weights current among the merchants.

17.verse: So the field of Ephron in Machpelah, which was to the east of Mamre [Hebron]--the field and the cave which was in it, and all the trees that were in the field and in all its borders round about--was made over

18.verse: As a possession to Abraham in the presence of the Hittites, before all who went in at his city gate.

19.verse: After this, Abraham buried Sarah his wife in the cave of the field of Machpelah to the east of Mamre, that is, Hebron, in the land of Canaan.

20.verse: The field and the cave in it were conveyed to Abraham for a permanent burial place by the sons of Heth.

1.verse: NOW ABRAHAM was old, well advanced in years, and the Lord had blessed Abraham in all things.

2.verse: And Abraham said to the eldest servant of his house [Eliezer of Damascus], who ruled over all that he had, I beg of you, put your hand under my thigh;

3.verse: And you shall swear by the Lord, the God of heaven and earth, that you will not take a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites, among whom I have settled,

4.verse: But you shall go to my country and to my relatives and take a wife for my son Isaac.

5.verse: The servant said to him, But perhaps the woman will not be willing to come along after me to this country. Must I take your son to the country from which you came?

6.verse: Abraham said to him, See to it that you do not take my son back there.

7.verse: The Lord, the God of heaven, Who took me from my father's house, from the land of my family and my birth, Who spoke to me and swore to me, saying, To your offspring I will give this land--He will send His Angel before you, and you will take a wife from there for my son.

8.verse: And if the woman should not be willing to go along after you, then you will be clear from this oath; only you must not take my son back there.

9.verse: So the servant put his hand under the thigh of Abraham his master and swore to him concerning this matter.

10.verse: And the servant took ten of his master's camels and departed, taking some of all his master's treasures with him; thus he journeyed to Mesopotamia [between the Tigris and the Euphrates], to the city of Nahor [Abraham's brother].

11.verse: And he made his camels to kneel down outside the city by a well of water at the time of the evening when women go out to draw water.

12.verse: And he said, O Lord, God of my master Abraham, I pray You, cause me to meet with good success today, and show kindness to my master Abraham.

13.verse: See, I stand here by the well of water, and the daughters of the men of the city are coming to draw water.

14.verse: And let it so be that the girl to whom I say, I pray you, let down your jar that I may drink, and she replies, Drink, and I will give your camels drink also--let her be the one whom You have selected and appointed and indicated for Your servant Isaac [to be a wife to him]; and by it I shall know that You have shown kindness and faithfulness to my master.

15.verse: Before he had finished speaking, behold, out came Rebekah, who was the daughter of Bethuel son of Milcah, who was the wife of Nahor the brother of Abraham, with her water jar on her shoulder.

16.verse: And the girl was very beautiful and attractive, chaste and modest, and unmarried. And she went down to the well, filled her water jar, and came up.

17.verse: And the servant ran to meet her, and said, I pray you, let me drink a little water from your water jar.

18.verse: And she said, Drink, my lord; and she quickly let down her jar onto her hand and gave him a drink.

19.verse: When she had given him a drink, she said, I will draw water for your camels also, until they finish drinking.

20.verse: So she quickly emptied her jar into the trough and ran again to the well and drew water for all his camels.

21.verse: The man stood gazing at her in silence, waiting to know if the Lord had made his trip prosperous.

22.verse: And when the camels had finished drinking, the man took a gold earring or nose ring of half a shekel in weight, and for her hands two bracelets of ten shekels in weight in gold,

23.verse: And said, Whose daughter are you? I pray you, tell me: Is there room in your father's house for us to lodge there?

24.verse: And she said to him, I am the daughter of Bethuel son of Milcah and [her husband] Nahor.

25.verse: She said also to him, We have both straw and provender (fodder) enough, and also room in which to lodge.

26.verse: The man bowed down his head and worshiped the Lord

27.verse: And said, Blessed be the Lord, the God of my master Abraham, Who has not left my master bereft and destitute of His loving-kindness and steadfastness. As for me, going on the way [of obedience and faith] the Lord led me to the house of my master's kinsmen.

28.verse: The girl related to her mother's household what had happened.

29.verse: Now Rebekah had a brother whose name was Laban, and Laban ran out to the man at the well.

30.verse: For when he saw the earring or nose ring, and the bracelets on his sister's arms, and when he heard Rebekah his sister saying, The man said this to me, he went to the man and found him standing by the camels at the well.

31.verse: He cried, Come in, you blessed of the Lord! Why do you stand outside? For I have made the house ready and have prepared a place for the camels.

32.verse: So the man came into the house; and [Laban] ungirded his camels and gave straw and provender for the camels and water to bathe his feet and the feet of the men who were with him.

33.verse: A meal was set before him, but he said, I will not eat until I have told of my errand. And [Laban] said, Speak on.

34.verse: And he said, I am Abraham's servant.

35.verse: And the Lord has blessed my master mightily, and he has become great; and He has given him flocks, herds, silver, gold, menservants, maidservants, camels, and asses.

36.verse: And Sarah my master's wife bore a son to my master when she was old, and to him he has given all that he has.

37.verse: And my master made me swear, saying, You must not take a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites, in whose land I dwell,

38.verse: But you shall go to my father's house and to my family and take a wife for my son.

39.verse: And I said to my master, But suppose the woman will not follow me.

40.verse: And he said to me, The Lord, in Whose presence I walk [habitually], will send His Angel with you and prosper your way, and you will take a wife for my son from my kindred and from my father's house.

41.verse: Then you shall be clear from my oath, when you come to my kindred; and if they do not give her to you, you shall be free and innocent of my oath.

42.verse: I came today to the well and said, O Lord, God of my master Abraham, if You are now causing me to go on my way prosperously--

43.verse: See, I am standing by the well of water; now let it be that when the maiden comes out to draw water and I say to her, I pray you, give me a little water from your [water] jar to drink,

44.verse: And if she says to me, You drink, and I will draw water for your camels also, let that same woman be the one whom the Lord has selected and indicated for my master's son.

45.verse: And before I had finished praying in my heart, behold, Rebekah came out with her [water] jar on her shoulder, and she went down to the well and drew water. And I said to her, I pray you, let me have a drink.

46.verse: And she quickly let down her [water] jar from her shoulder and said, Drink, and I will water your camels also. So I drank, and she gave the camels drink also.

47.verse: I asked her, Whose daughter are you? She said, The daughter of Bethuel, Nahor's son, whom Milcah bore to him. And I put the earring or nose ring on her face and the bracelets on her arms.

48.verse: And I bowed down my head and worshiped the Lord and blessed the Lord, the God of my master Abraham, Who had led me in the right way to take my master's brother's daughter to his son.

49.verse: And now if you will deal kindly and truly with my master [showing faithfulness to him], tell me; and if not, tell me, that I may turn to the right or to the left.

50.verse: Then Laban and Bethuel answered, The thing comes forth from the Lord; we cannot speak bad or good to you.

51.verse: Rebekah is before you; take her and go, and let her be the wife of your master's son, as the Lord has said.

52.verse: And when Abraham's servant heard their words, he bowed himself to the ground before the Lord.

53.verse: And the servant brought out jewels of silver, jewels of gold, and garments and gave them to Rebekah; he also gave precious things to her brother and her mother.

54.verse: Then they ate and drank, he and the men who were with him, and stayed there all night. And in the morning they arose, and he said. Send me away to my master.

55.verse: But [Rebekah's] brother and mother said, Let the girl stay with us a few days--at least ten; then she may go.

56.verse: But [the servant] said to them, Do not hinder and delay me, seeing that the Lord has caused me to go prosperously on my way. Send me away, that I may go to my master.

57.verse: And they said, We will call the girl and ask her [what is] her desire.

58.verse: So they called Rebekah and said to her, Will you go with this man? And she said, I will go.

59.verse: So they sent away Rebekah their sister and her nurse [Deborah] and Abraham's servant and his men.

60.verse: And they blessed Rebekah and said to her, You are our sister; may you become the mother of thousands of ten thousands, and let your posterity possess the gate of their enemies.

61.verse: And Rebekah and her maids arose and followed the man upon their camels. Thus the servant took Rebekah and went on his way.

62.verse: Now Isaac had returned from going to the well Beer-lahai-roi [A well to the Living One Who sees me], for he [now] dwelt in the South country (the Negeb).

63.verse: And Isaac went out to meditate and bow down [in prayer] in the open country in the evening; and he looked up and saw that, behold, the camels were coming.

64.verse: And Rebekah looked up, and when she saw Isaac, she dismounted from the camel.

65.verse: For she [had] said to the servant, Who is that man walking across the field to meet us? And the servant [had] said, He is my master. So she took a veil and concealed herself with it.

66.verse: And the servant told Isaac everything that he had done.

67.verse: And Isaac brought her into his mother Sarah's tent, and he took Rebekah and she became his wife, and he loved her; thus Isaac was comforted after his mother's death.

1.verse: ABRAHAM TOOK another wife, and her name was Keturah.

2.verse: And she bore him Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah.

3.verse: Jokshan was the father of Sheba and Dedan. The sons of Dedan were Asshurim, Letushim, and Leummim.

4.verse: The sons of Midian were Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida, and Eldaah. All these were the children of Keturah.

5.verse: And Abraham gave all that he had to Isaac.

6.verse: But to the sons of his concubines [Hagar and Keturah] Abraham gave gifts, and while he was still living he sent them to the east country, away from Isaac his son [of promise].

7.verse: The days of Abraham's life were 175 years.

8.verse: Then Abraham's spirit was released, and he died at a good (ample, full) old age, an old man, satisfied and satiated, and was gathered to his people.

9.verse: And his sons Isaac and Ishmael buried him in the cave of Machpelah, in the field of Ephron the son of Zohar the Hittite, which is east of Mamre,

10.verse: The field which Abraham purchased from the Hittites. There Abraham was buried with Sarah his wife.

11.verse: After the death of Abraham, God blessed his son Isaac, and Isaac dwelt at Beer-lahai-roi [A well to the Living One Who sees me].

12.verse: Now this is the history of the descendants of Ishmael, Abraham's son, whom Hagar the Egyptian, Sarah's handmaid, bore to Abraham.

13.verse: These are the names of the sons of Ishmael, named in the order of their births: Nebaioth, the firstborn of Ishmael, and Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,

14.verse: Mishma, Dumah, Massa,

15.verse: Hadad, Tema, Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah.

16.verse: These are the sons of Ishmael, and these are their names, by their villages and by their encampments (sheepfolds)--twelve princes according to their tribes. [Foretold in Gen. 17:20.]

17.verse: And Ishmael lived 137 years; then his spirit left him, and he died and was gathered to his kindred.

18.verse: And [Ishmael's sons] dwelt from Havilah to Shur, which is before Egypt in the direction of Assyria. [Ishmael] dwelt close [to the lands] of all his brethren.

19.verse: And this is the history of the descendants of Isaac, Abraham's son: Abraham was the father of Isaac.

20.verse: Isaac was forty years old when he married Rebekah, the daughter of Bethuel the Aramean of Padan-aram, the sister of Laban the Aramean.

21.verse: And Isaac prayed much to the Lord for his wife because she was unable to bear children; and the Lord granted his prayer, and Rebekah his wife became pregnant.

22.verse: [Two] children struggled together within her; and she said, If it is so [that the Lord has heard our prayer], why am I like this? And she went to inquire of the Lord.

23.verse: The Lord said to her, [The founders of] two nations are in your womb, and the separation of two peoples has begun in your body; the one people shall be stronger than the other, and the elder shall serve the younger.

24.verse: When her days to be delivered were fulfilled, behold, there were twins in her womb.

25.verse: The first came out red all over like a hairy garment, and they named him Esau [hairy].

26.verse: Afterward his brother came forth, and his hand grasped Esau's heel; so he was named Jacob [supplanter]. Isaac was sixty years old when she gave birth to them.

27.verse: When the boys grew up, Esau was a cunning and skilled hunter, a man of the outdoors; but Jacob was a plain and quiet man, dwelling in tents.

28.verse: And Isaac loved [and was partial to] Esau, because he ate of Esau's game; but Rebekah loved Jacob.

29.verse: Jacob was boiling pottage (lentil stew) one day, when Esau came from the field and was faint [with hunger].

30.verse: And Esau said to Jacob, I beg of you, let me have some of that red lentil stew to eat, for I am faint and famished! That is why his name was called Edom [red].

31.verse: Jacob answered, Then sell me today your birthright (the rights of a firstborn).

32.verse: Esau said, See here, I am at the point of death; what good can this birthright do me?

33.verse: Jacob said, Swear to me today [that you are selling it to me]; and he swore to [Jacob] and sold him his birthright.

34.verse: Then Jacob gave Esau bread and stew of lentils, and he ate and drank and rose up and went his way. Thus Esau scorned his birthright as beneath his notice.

1.verse: AND THERE was a famine in the land, other than the former famine that was in the days of Abraham. And Isaac went to Gerar, to Abimelech king of the Philistines.

2.verse: And the Lord appeared to him and said, Do not go down to Egypt; live in the land of which I will tell you.

3.verse: Dwell temporarily in this land, and I will be with you and will favor you with blessings; for to you and to your descendants I will give all these lands, and I will perform the oath which I swore to Abraham your father.

4.verse: And I will make your descendants to multiply as the stars of the heavens, and will give to your posterity all these lands (kingdoms); and by your Offspring shall all the nations of the earth be blessed, or by Him bless themselves,

5.verse: For Abraham listened to and obeyed My voice and kept My charge, My commands, My statutes, and My laws.

6.verse: So Isaac stayed in Gerar.

7.verse: And the men of the place asked him about his wife, and he said, She is my sister; for he was afraid to say, She is my wife--[thinking], Lest the men of the place should kill me for Rebekah, because she is attractive and is beautiful to look upon.

8.verse: When he had been there a long time, Abimelech king of the Philistines looked out of a window and saw Isaac caressing Rebekah his wife.

9.verse: And Abimelech called Isaac and said, See here, she is certainly your wife! How did you [dare] say to me, She is my sister? And Isaac said to him, Because I thought, Lest I die on account of her.

10.verse: And Abimelech said, What is this you have done to us? One of the men might easily have lain with your wife, and you would have brought guilt and sin upon us.

11.verse: Then Abimelech charged all his people, He who touches this man or his wife shall surely be put to death.

12.verse: Then Isaac sowed seed in that land and received in the same year a hundred times as much as he had planted, and the Lord favored him with blessings.

13.verse: And the man became great and gained more and more until he became very wealthy and distinguished;

14.verse: He owned flocks, herds, and a great supply of servants, and the Philistines envied him.

15.verse: Now all the wells which his father's servants had dug in the days of Abraham his father, the Philistines had closed and filled with earth.

16.verse: And Abimelech said to Isaac, Go away from us, for you are much mightier than we are.

17.verse: So Isaac went away from there and pitched his tent in the Valley of Gerar, and dwelt there.

18.verse: And Isaac dug again the wells of water which had been dug in the days of Abraham his father, for the Philistines had stopped them after the death of Abraham; and he gave them the names by which his father had called them.

19.verse: Now Isaac's servants dug in the valley and found there a well of living [spring] water.

20.verse: And the herdsmen of Gerar quarreled with Isaac's herdsmen, saying, The water is ours. And he named the well Esek [contention] because they quarreled with him.

21.verse: Then [his servants] dug another well, and they quarreled over that also; so he named it Sitnah [enmity].

22.verse: And he moved away from there and dug another well, and for that one they did not quarrel. He named it Rehoboth [room], saying, For now the Lord has made room for us, and we shall be fruitful in the land.

23.verse: Now he went up from there to Beersheba.

24.verse: And the Lord appeared to him the same night and said, I am the God of Abraham your father. Fear not, for I am with you and will favor you with blessings and multiply your descendants for the sake of My servant Abraham.

25.verse: And [Isaac] built an altar there and called on the name of the Lord and pitched his tent there; and there Isaac's servants were digging a well.

26.verse: Then Abimelech went to him from Gerar with Ahuzzah, one of his friends, and Phicol, his army's commander.

27.verse: And Isaac said to them, Why have you come to me, seeing that you hate me and have sent me away from you?

28.verse: They said, We saw that the Lord was certainly with you; so we said, Let there be now an oath between us [carrying a curse with it to befall the one who breaks it], even between you and us, and let us make a covenant with you

29.verse: That you will do us no harm, inasmuch as we have not touched you and have done to you nothing but good and have sent you away in peace. You are now the blessed or favored of the Lord!

30.verse: And he made them a [formal] dinner, and they ate and drank.

31.verse: And they rose up early in the morning and took oaths [with a curse] with one another; and Isaac sent them on their way and they departed from him in peace.

32.verse: That same day Isaac's servants came and told him about the well they had dug, saying, We have found water!

33.verse: And he named [the well] Shibah; therefore the name of the city is Beersheba [well of the oath] to this day.

34.verse: Now Esau was 40 years old when he took as wife Judith the daughter of Beeri the Hittite, and Basemath the daughter of Elon the Hittite.

35.verse: And they made life bitter and a grief of mind and spirit for Isaac and Rebekah [their parents-in-law].

1.verse: WHEN ISAAC was old and his eyes were dim so that he could not see, he called Esau his elder son, and said to him, My son! And he answered him, Here I am.

2.verse: He said, See here now; I am old, I do not know when I may die.

3.verse: So now, I pray you, take your weapons, your [arrows in a] quiver and your bow, and go out into the open country and hunt game for me,

4.verse: And prepare me appetizing meat, such as I love, and bring it to me, that I may eat of it, [preparatory] to giving you my blessing [as my firstborn] before I die.

5.verse: But Rebekah heard what Isaac said to Esau his son; and when Esau had gone to the open country to hunt for game that he might bring it,

6.verse: Rebekah said to Jacob her younger son, See here, I heard your father say to Esau your brother,

7.verse: Bring me game and make me appetizing meat, so that I may eat and declare my blessing upon you before the Lord before my death.

8.verse: So now, my son, do exactly as I command you.

9.verse: Go now to the flock, and from it bring me two good and suitable kids; and I will make them into appetizing meat for your father, such as he loves.

10.verse: And you shall bring it to your father, that he may eat and declare his blessing upon you before his death.

11.verse: But Jacob said to Rebekah his mother, Listen, Esau my brother is a hairy man and I am a smooth man.

12.verse: Suppose my father feels me; I will seem to him to be a cheat and an imposter, and I will bring [his] curse on me and not [his] blessing.

13.verse: But his mother said to him, On me be your curse, my son; only obey my word and go, fetch them to me.

14.verse: So [Jacob] went, got [the kids], and brought them to his mother; and his mother prepared appetizing meat with a delightful odor, such as his father loved.

15.verse: Then Rebekah took her elder son Esau's best clothes which were with her in the house, and put them on Jacob her younger son.

16.verse: And she put the skins of the kids on his hands and on the smooth part of his neck.

17.verse: And she gave the savory meat and the bread which she had prepared into the hand of her son Jacob.

18.verse: So he went to his father and said, My father. And he said, Here am I; who are you, my son?

19.verse: And Jacob said to his father, I am Esau your firstborn; I have done what you told me to do. Now sit up and eat of my game, so that you may proceed to bless me.

20.verse: And Isaac said to his son, How is it that you have found the game so quickly, my son? And he said, Because the Lord your God caused it to come to me.

21.verse: But Isaac said to Jacob, Come close to me, I beg of you, that I may feel you, my son, and know whether you really are my son Esau or not.

22.verse: So Jacob went near to Isaac, and his father felt him and said, The voice is Jacob's voice, but the hands are the hands of Esau.

23.verse: He could not identify him, because his hands were hairy like his brother Esau's hands; so he blessed him.

24.verse: But he said, Are you really my son Esau? He answered, I am.

25.verse: Then [Isaac] said, Bring it to me and I will eat of my son's game, that I may bless you. He brought it to him and he ate; and he brought him wine and he drank.

26.verse: Then his father Isaac said, Come near and kiss me, my son.

27.verse: So he came near and kissed him; and [Isaac] smelled his clothing and blessed him and said, The scent of my son is as the odor of a field which the Lord has blessed.

28.verse: And may God give you of the dew of the heavens and of the fatness of the earth and abundance of grain and [new] wine;

29.verse: Let peoples serve you and nations bow down to you; be master over your brothers, and let your mother's sons bow down to you. Let everyone be cursed who curses you and favored with blessings who blesses you.

30.verse: As soon as Isaac had finished blessing Jacob and Jacob was scarcely gone out from the presence of Isaac his father, Esau his brother came in from his hunting.

31.verse: Esau had also prepared savory food and brought it to his father and said to him, Let my father arise and eat of his son's game, that you may bless me.

32.verse: And Isaac his father said to him, Who are you? And he replied, I am your son, your firstborn, Esau.

33.verse: Then Isaac trembled and shook violently, and he said, Who? Where is he who has hunted game and brought it to me, and I ate of it all before you came and I have blessed him? Yes, and he shall be blessed.

34.verse: When Esau heard the words of his father, he cried out with a great and bitter cry and said to his father, Bless me, even me also, O my father!

35.verse: [Isaac] said, Your brother came with crafty cunning and treacherous deceit and has taken your blessing.

36.verse: [Esau] replied, Is he not rightly named Jacob [the supplanter]? For he has supplanted me these two times: he took away my birthright, and now he has taken away my blessing! Have you not still a blessing reserved for me?

37.verse: And Isaac answered Esau, Behold, I have made [Jacob] your lord and master; I have given all his brethren to him for servants, and with corn and [new] wine have I sustained him. What then can I do for you, my son?

38.verse: Esau said to his father, Have you only one blessing, my father? Bless me, even me also, O my father! And Esau lifted up [could not control] his voice and wept aloud.

39.verse: Then Isaac his father answered, Your [blessing and] dwelling shall all come from the fruitfulness of the earth and from the dew of the heavens above;

40.verse: By your sword you shall live and serve your brother. But [the time shall come] when you will grow restive and break loose, and you shall tear his yoke from off your neck.

41.verse: And Esau hated Jacob because of the blessing with which his father blessed him; and Esau said in his heart, The days of mourning for my father are very near. When [he is gone] I will kill my brother Jacob.

42.verse: These words of Esau her elder son were repeated to Rebekah. She sent for Jacob her younger son and said to him, See here, your brother Esau comforts himself concerning you [by intending] to kill you.

43.verse: So now, my son, do what I tell you; arise, flee to my brother Laban in Haran;

44.verse: Linger and dwell with him for a while until your brother's fury is spent.

45.verse: When your brother's anger is diverted from you, he will forget [the wrong] that you have done him. Then I will send and bring you back from there. Why should I be deprived of both of you in one day?

46.verse: Then Rebekah said to Isaac, I am weary of my life because of the daughters of Heth [these wives of Esau]! If Jacob takes a wife of the daughters of Heth such as these Hittite girls around here, what good will my life be to me?

1.verse: SO ISAAC called Jacob and blessed him and commanded him, You shall not marry one of the women of Canaan.

2.verse: Arise, go to Padan-aram, to the house of Bethuel your mother's father, and take from there as a wife one of the daughters of Laban your mother's brother.

3.verse: May God Almighty bless you and make you fruitful and multiply you until you become a group of peoples.

4.verse: May He give the blessing [He gave to] Abraham to you and your descendants with you, that you may inherit the land He gave to Abraham, in which you are a sojourner.

5.verse: Thus Isaac sent Jacob away. He went to Padan-aram, to Laban son of Bethuel the Aramean, the brother of Rebekah, Jacob and Esau's mother.

6.verse: Now Esau saw that Isaac had blessed Jacob and sent him to Padan-aram to take him a wife from there, and that as he blessed him, he gave him a charge, saying, You shall not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan;

7.verse: And that Jacob obeyed his father and his mother and had gone to Padan-aram.

8.verse: Also Esau saw that the daughters of Canaan did not please Isaac his father.

9.verse: So Esau went to Ishmael and took to be his wife, [in addition] to the wives he [already] had, Mahalath daughter of Ishmael, Abraham's son, the sister of Nebaioth.

10.verse: And Jacob left Beersheba and went toward Haran.

11.verse: And he came to a certain place and stayed there overnight, because the sun was set. Taking one of the stones of the place, he put it under his head and lay down there to sleep.

12.verse: And he dreamed that there was a ladder set up on the earth, and the top of it reached to heaven; and the angels of God were ascending and descending on it!

13.verse: And behold, the Lord stood over and beside him and said, I am the Lord, the God of Abraham your father [forefather] and the God of Isaac; I will give to you and to your descendants the land on which you are lying.

14.verse: And your offspring shall be as [countless as] the dust or sand of the ground, and you shall spread abroad to the west and the east and the north and the south; and by you and your Offspring shall all the families of the earth be blessed and bless themselves.

15.verse: And behold, I am with you and will keep (watch over you with care, take notice of) you wherever you may go, and I will bring you back to this land; for I will not leave you until I have done all of which I have told you.

16.verse: And Jacob awoke from his sleep and he said, Surely the Lord is in this place and I did not know it.

17.verse: He was afraid and said, How to be feared and reverenced is this place! This is none other than the house of God, and this is the gateway to heaven!

18.verse: And Jacob rose early in the morning and took the stone he had put under his head, and he set it up for a pillar (a monument to the vision in his dream), and he poured oil on its top [in dedication].

19.verse: And he named that place Bethel [the house of God]; but the name of that city was Luz at first.

20.verse: Then Jacob made a vow, saying, If God will be with me and will keep me in this way that I go and will give me food to eat and clothing to wear,

21.verse: So that I may come again to my father's house in peace, then the Lord shall be my God;

22.verse: And this stone which I have set up as a pillar (monument) shall be God's house [a sacred place to me], and of all [the increase of possessions] that You give me I will give the tenth to You.

1.verse: THEN JACOB went [briskly and cheerfully] on his way [400 miles] and came to the land of the people of the East.

2.verse: As he looked, he saw a well in the field; and behold, there were three flocks of sheep lying by it, for out of that well the flocks were watered. The stone on the well's mouth was a big one,

3.verse: And when all the flocks were gathered there, [the shepherds] would roll the stone from the well's mouth, water the sheep, and replace the stone on the well's mouth.

4.verse: And Jacob said to them, My brothers, where are you from? And they said, We are from Haran.

5.verse: [Jacob] said to them, Do you know Laban the grandson of Nahor? And they said, We know him.

6.verse: He said to them, Is it well with him? And they said, He is doing well; and behold, here comes his daughter Rachel with [his] sheep!

7.verse: He said, The sun is still high; it is a long time yet before the flocks need be gathered [in their folds]. [Why not] water the sheep and return them to their pasture?

8.verse: But they said, We cannot until all the flocks are gathered together; then [the shepherds] roll the stone from the well's mouth and we water the sheep.

9.verse: While he was still talking with them, Rachel came with her father's sheep, for she shepherded them.

10.verse: When Jacob saw Rachel daughter of Laban, his mother's brother, and the sheep of Laban his uncle, Jacob went near and rolled the stone from the well's mouth and watered the flock of his uncle Laban.

11.verse: Then Jacob kissed Rachel and he wept aloud.

12.verse: Jacob told Rachel he was her father's relative, Rebekah's son; and she ran and told her father.

13.verse: When Laban heard of the arrival of Jacob his sister's son, he ran to meet him, and embraced and kissed him and brought him to his house. And [Jacob] told Laban all these things.

14.verse: Then Laban said to him, Surely you are my bone and my flesh. And [Jacob] stayed with him a month.

15.verse: Then Laban said to Jacob, Just because you are my relative, should you work for me for nothing? Tell me, what shall your wages be?

16.verse: Now Laban had two daughters; the name of the elder was Leah and the name of the younger was Rachel.

17.verse: Leah's eyes were weak and dull looking, but Rachel was beautiful and attractive.

18.verse: And Jacob loved Rachel; so he said, I will work for you for seven years for Rachel your younger daughter.

19.verse: And Laban said, It is better that I give her to you than to another man. Stay and live with me.

20.verse: And Jacob served seven years for Rachel; and they seemed to him but a few days because of the love he had for her.

21.verse: Finally, Jacob said to Laban, Give me my wife, for my time is completed, so that I may take her to me.

22.verse: And Laban gathered together all the men of the place and made a feast [with drinking].

23.verse: But when night came, he took Leah his daughter and brought her to [Jacob], who had intercourse with her.

24.verse: And Laban gave Zilpah his maid to his daughter Leah to be her maid.

25.verse: But in the morning [Jacob saw his wife, and] behold, it was Leah! And he said to Laban, What is this you have done to me? Did I not work for you [all those seven years] for Rachel? Why then have you deceived and cheated and thrown me down [like this]?

26.verse: And Laban said, It is not permitted in our country to give the younger [in marriage] before the elder.

27.verse: Finish the [wedding feast] week [for Leah]; then we will give you [Rachel] also, and you shall work for me yet seven more years in return.

28.verse: So Jacob complied and fulfilled [Leah's] week; then [Laban] gave him Rachel his daughter as his wife.

29.verse: (And Laban gave Bilhah his maid to Rachel his daughter to be her maid.)

30.verse: And Jacob lived with Rachel also as his wife, and he loved Rachel more than Leah and served [Laban] another seven years [for her].

31.verse: And when the Lord saw that Leah was despised, He made her able to bear children, but Rachel was barren.

32.verse: And Leah became pregnant and bore a son and named him Reuben [See, a son!]; for she said, Because the Lord has seen my humiliation and affliction; now my husband will love me.

33.verse: [Leah] became pregnant again and bore a son and said, Because the Lord heard that I am despised, He has given me this son also; and she named him Simeon [God hears].

34.verse: And she became pregnant again and bore a son and said, Now this time will my husband be a companion to me, for I have borne him three sons. Therefore he was named Levi [companion].

35.verse: Again she conceived and bore a son, and she said, Now will I praise the Lord! So she called his name Judah [praise]; then [for a time] she ceased bearing.

1.verse: WHEN RACHEL saw that she bore Jacob no children, she envied her sister, and said to Jacob, Give me children, or else I will die!

2.verse: And Jacob became very angry with Rachel and he said, Am I in God's stead, Who has denied you children?

3.verse: And she said, See here, take my maid Bilhah and have intercourse with her; and [when the baby comes] she shall deliver it upon my knees, that I by her may also have children.

4.verse: And she gave him Bilhah her maid as a [secondary] wife, and Jacob had intercourse with her.

5.verse: And Bilhah became pregnant and bore Jacob a son.

6.verse: And Rachel said, God has judged and vindicated me, and has heard my plea and has given me a son; so she named him Dan [judged].

7.verse: And Bilhah, Rachel's maid, conceived again and bore Jacob a second son.

8.verse: And Rachel said, With mighty wrestlings [in prayer to God] I have struggled with my sister and have prevailed; so she named him [this second son Bilhah bore] Naphtali [struggled].

9.verse: When Leah saw that she had ceased to bear, she gave Zilpah her maid to Jacob as a [secondary] wife.

10.verse: And Zilpah, Leah's maid, bore Jacob a son.

11.verse: Then Leah said, Victory and good fortune have come; and she named him Gad [fortune].

12.verse: Zilpah, Leah's maid, bore Jacob [her] second son.

13.verse: And Leah said, I am happy, for women will call me blessed (happy, fortunate, to be envied); and she named him Asher [happy].

14.verse: Now Reuben went at the time of wheat harvest and found some mandrakes (love apples) in the field and brought them to his mother Leah. Then Rachel said to Leah, Give me, I pray you, some of your son's mandrakes.

15.verse: But [Leah] answered, Is it not enough that you have taken my husband without your taking away my son's mandrakes also? And Rachel said, Jacob shall sleep with you tonight [in exchange] for your son's mandrakes.

16.verse: And Jacob came out of the field in the evening, and Leah went out to meet him and said, You must sleep with me [tonight], for I have certainly paid your hire with my son's mandrakes. So he slept with her that night.

17.verse: And God heeded Leah's [prayer], and she conceived and bore Jacob [her] fifth son.

18.verse: Leah said, God has given me my hire, because I have given my maid to my husband; and she called his name Issachar [hired].

19.verse: And Leah became pregnant again and bore Jacob [her] sixth son.

20.verse: Then Leah said, God has endowed me with a good marriage gift [for my husband]; now will he dwell with me [and regard me as his wife in reality], because I have borne him six sons; and she named him Zebulun [dwelling].

21.verse: Afterwards she bore a daughter and called her Dinah.

22.verse: Then God remembered Rachel and answered her pleading and made it possible for her to have children.

23.verse: And [now for the first time] she became pregnant and bore a son; and she said, God has taken away my reproach, disgrace, and humiliation.

24.verse: And she called his name Joseph [may he add] and said, May the Lord add to me another son.

25.verse: When Rachel had borne Joseph, Jacob said to Laban, Send me away, that I may go to my own place and country.

26.verse: Give me my wives and my children, for whom I have served you, and let me go; for you know the work which I have done for you.

27.verse: And Laban said to him, If I have found favor in your sight, I pray you [do not go]; for I have learned by experience and from the omens in divination that the Lord has favored me with blessings on your account.

28.verse: He said, State your salary and I will give it.

29.verse: Jacob answered him, You know how I have served you, and how your possessions, your cattle and sheep and goats, have fared with me.

30.verse: For you had little before I came, and it has increased and multiplied abundantly; and the Lord has favored you with blessings wherever I turned. But now, when shall I provide for my own house also?

31.verse: [Laban] said, What shall I give you? And Jacob said, You shall not give me anything, if you will do this one thing for me [of which I am about to tell you], and I will again feed and take care of your flock.

32.verse: Let me pass through all your flock today, removing from it every speckled and spotted animal and every black one among the sheep, and the spotted and speckled among the goats; and such shall be my wages.

33.verse: So later when the matter of my wages is brought before you, my fair dealing will be evident and answer for me. Every one that is not speckled and spotted among the goats and black among the sheep, if found with me, shall be counted as stolen.

34.verse: And Laban said, Good; let it be done as you say.

35.verse: But that same day [Laban] removed the he-goats that were streaked and spotted and all the she-goats that were speckled and spotted, every one that had white on it, and every black lamb, and put them in charge of his sons.

36.verse: And he set [a distance of] three days' journey between himself and Jacob; and Jacob was then left in care of the rest of Laban's flock.

37.verse: But Jacob took fresh rods of poplar and almond and plane trees and peeled white streaks in them, exposing the white in the rods.

38.verse: Then he set the rods which he had peeled in front of the flocks in the watering troughs where the flocks came to drink. And since they bred and conceived when they came to drink,

39.verse: The flocks bred and conceived in sight of the rods and brought forth lambs and kids streaked, speckled, and spotted.

40.verse: Jacob separated the lambs, and [as he had done with the peeled rods] he also set the faces of the flocks toward the streaked and all the dark in the [new] flock of Laban; and he put his own droves by themselves and did not let them breed with Laban's flock.

41.verse: And whenever the stronger animals were breeding, Jacob laid the rods in the watering troughs before the eyes of the flock, that they might breed and conceive among the rods.

42.verse: But when the sheep and goats were feeble, he omitted putting the rods there; so the feebler animals were Laban's and the stronger Jacob's.

43.verse: Thus the man increased and became exceedingly rich, and had many sheep and goats, and maidservants, menservants, camels, and donkeys.

1.verse: JACOB HEARD Laban's sons complaining, Jacob has taken away all that was our father's; he has acquired all this wealth and honor from what belonged to our father.

2.verse: And Jacob noticed that Laban looked at him less favorably than before.

3.verse: Then the Lord said to Jacob, Return to the land of your fathers and to your people, and I will be with you.

4.verse: So Jacob sent and called Rachel and Leah to the field to his flock,

5.verse: And he said to them, I see how your father looks at me, that he is not [friendly] toward me as before; but the God of my father has been with me.

6.verse: You know that I have served your father with all my might and power.

7.verse: But your father has deceived me and changed my wages ten times, but God did not allow him to hurt me.

8.verse: If he said, The speckled shall be your wages, then all the flock bore speckled; and if he said, The streaked shall be your hire, then all the flock bore streaked.

9.verse: Thus God has taken away the flocks of your father and given them to me.

10.verse: And I had a dream at the time the flock conceived. I looked up and saw that the rams which mated with the she-goats were streaked, speckled, and spotted.

11.verse: And the Angel of God said to me in the dream, Jacob. And I said, Here am I.

12.verse: And He said, Look up and see, all the rams which mate with the flock are streaked, speckled, and mottled; for I have seen all that Laban does to you.

13.verse: I am the God of Bethel, where you anointed the pillar and where you vowed a vow to Me. Now arise, get out from this land and return to your native land.

14.verse: And Rachel and Leah answered him, Is there any portion or inheritance for us in our father's house?

15.verse: Are we not counted by him as strangers? For he sold us and has also quite devoured our money [the price you paid for us].

16.verse: For all the riches which God has taken from our father are ours and our children's. Now then, whatever God has said to you, do it.

17.verse: Then Jacob rose up and set his sons and his wives upon the camels;

18.verse: And he drove away all his livestock and all his gain which he had gotten, the livestock he had obtained and accumulated in Padan-aram, to go to Isaac his father in the land of Canaan.

19.verse: Now Laban had gone to shear his sheep [possibly to the feast of sheepshearing], and Rachel stole her father's household gods.

20.verse: And Jacob outwitted Laban the Syrian [Aramean] in that he did not tell him that he [intended] to flee and slip away secretly.

21.verse: So he fled with all that he had, and arose and crossed the river [Euphrates] and set his face toward the hill country of Gilead.

22.verse: But on the third day Laban was told that Jacob had fled.

23.verse: So he took his kinsmen with him and pursued after [Jacob] for seven days, and they overtook him in the hill country of Gilead.

24.verse: But God came to Laban the Syrian [Aramean] in a dream by night and said to him, Be careful that you do not speak from good to bad to Jacob [peaceably, then violently].

25.verse: Then Laban overtook Jacob. Now Jacob had pitched his tent on the hill, and Laban coming with his kinsmen pitched [his tents] on the same hill of Gilead.

26.verse: And Laban said to Jacob, What do you mean stealing away and leaving like this without my knowing it, and carrying off my daughters as if captives of the sword?

27.verse: Why did you flee secretly and cheat me and did not tell me, so that I might have sent you away with joy and gladness and with singing, with tambourine and lyre?

28.verse: And why did you not permit me to kiss my sons [grandchildren] and my daughters good-bye? Now you have done foolishly [in behaving like this].

29.verse: It is in my power to do you harm; but the God of your father spoke to me last night, saying, Be careful that you do not speak from good to bad to Jacob [peaceably, then violently].

30.verse: And now you felt you must go because you were homesick for your father's house, but why did you steal my [household] gods?

31.verse: Jacob answered Laban, Because I was afraid; for I thought, Suppose you would take your daughters from me by force.

32.verse: The one with whom you find those gods of yours, let him not live. Here before our kinsmen [search my possessions and] take whatever you find that belongs to you. For Jacob did not know that Rachel had stolen [the images].

33.verse: So Laban went into Jacob's tent and into Leah's tent and the tent of the two maids, but he did not find them. Then he went from Leah's tent into Rachel's tent.

34.verse: Now Rachel had taken the images (gods) and put them in the camel's saddle and sat on them. Laban searched and felt through all the tent, but did not find them.

35.verse: And [Rachel] said to her father, Do not be displeased, my lord, that I cannot rise up before you, for the period of women is upon me and I am unwell. And he searched, but did not find the gods.

36.verse: Then Jacob became angry and reproached and argued with Laban. And Jacob said to Laban, What is my fault? What is my sin, that you so hotly pursued me?

37.verse: Although you have searched and felt through all my household possessions, what have you found of all your household goods? Put it here before my brethren and yours, that they may judge and decide between us.

38.verse: These twenty years I have been with you; your ewes and your she-goats have not lost their young, and the rams of your flock have not been eaten by me.

39.verse: I did not bring you [the carcasses of the animals] torn by wild beasts; I bore the loss of it; you required of me [to make good] all that was stolen, whether it occurred by day or by night.

40.verse: This was [my lot]; by day the heat consumed me and by night the cold, and I could not sleep.

41.verse: I have been twenty years in your house. I served you fourteen years for your two daughters and six years for your flocks; and you have changed my wages ten times.

42.verse: And if the God of my father, the God of Abraham and the Dread [lest he should fall] and Fear [lest he offend] of Isaac, had not been with me, surely you would have sent me away now empty-handed. God has seen my affliction and humiliation and the [wearying] labor of my hands and rebuked you last night.

43.verse: Laban answered Jacob, These daughters are my daughters, these children are my children, these flocks are my flocks, and all that you see is mine. But what can I do today to these my daughters or to their children whom they have borne?

44.verse: So come now, let us make a covenant or league, you and I, and let it be for a witness between you and me.

45.verse: So Jacob set up a stone for a pillar or monument.

46.verse: And Jacob said to his brethren, Gather stones; and they took stones and made a heap, and they ate [together] there upon the heap.

47.verse: Laban called it Jegar-sahadutha [witness heap, in Aramaic ], but Jacob called it Galeed [witness heap, in Hebrew. ]

48.verse: Laban said, This heap is a witness today between you and me. Therefore it was named Galeed.

49.verse: And [the pillar or monument was called] Mizpah [watchpost], for he [Laban] said, May the Lord watch between you and me when we are absent and hidden one from another.

50.verse: If you should afflict, humiliate, or lower [divorce] my daughters, or if you should take other wives beside my daughters, although no man is with us [to witness], see (remember), God is witness between you and me.

51.verse: And Laban said to Jacob, See this heap and this pillar, which I have set up between you and me.

52.verse: This heap is a witness and this pillar is a witness, that I will not pass by this heap to you, and that you will not pass by this heap and this pillar to me, for harm.

53.verse: The God of Abraham and the God of Nahor, and the god [the object of worship] of their father [Terah, an idolator], judge between us. But Jacob swore [only] by [the one true God] the Dread and Fear of his father Isaac.

54.verse: Then Jacob offered a sacrifice on the mountain and called his brethren to eat food; and they ate food and lingered all night on the mountain.

55.verse: And early in the morning Laban rose up and kissed his grandchildren and his daughters and pronounced a blessing [asking God's favor] on them. Then Laban departed and returned to his home.

1.verse: THEN JACOB went on his way, and God's angels met him.

2.verse: When Jacob saw them, he said, This is God's army! So he named that place Mahanaim [two armies].

3.verse: And Jacob sent messengers before him to Esau his brother in the land of Seir, the country of Edom.

4.verse: And he commanded them, Say this to my lord Esau: Your servant Jacob says this: I have been living temporarily with Laban and have stayed there till now.

5.verse: And I have oxen, donkeys, flocks, menservants, and women servants; and I have sent to tell my lord, that I may find mercy and kindness in your sight.

6.verse: And the messengers returned to Jacob, saying, We came to your brother Esau; and now he is [on the way] to meet you, and four hundred men are with him.

7.verse: Then Jacob was greatly afraid and distressed; and he divided the people who were with him, and the flocks and herds and camels, into two groups,

8.verse: Thinking, If Esau comes to the one group and smites it, then the other group which is left will escape.

9.verse: Jacob said, O God of my father Abraham and God of my father Isaac, the Lord Who said to me, Return to your country and to your people and I will do you good,

10.verse: I am not worthy of the least of all the mercy and loving-kindness and all the faithfulness which You have shown to Your servant, for with [only] my staff I passed over this Jordan [long ago], and now I have become two companies.

11.verse: Deliver me, I pray You, from the hand of my brother, from the hand of Esau; for I fear him, lest he come and smite [us all], the mothers with the children.

12.verse: And You said, I will surely do you good and make your descendants as the sand of the sea, which cannot be numbered for multitude.

13.verse: And Jacob lodged there that night and took from what he had with him as a present for his brother Esau:

14.verse: Two hundred she-goats, 20 he-goats, 200 ewes, 20 rams,

15.verse: Thirty milk camels with their colts, 40 cows, 10 bulls, 20 she-donkeys, and 10 [donkey] colts.

16.verse: And he put them into the charge of his servants, every drove by itself, and said to his servants, Pass over before me and put a space between drove and drove.

17.verse: And he commanded the first, When Esau my brother meets you and asks to whom you belong, where you are going, and whose are the animals before you,

18.verse: Then you shall say, They are your servant Jacob's; it is a present sent to my lord Esau; and moreover, he is behind us.

19.verse: And so he commanded the second and the third and all that followed the droves, saying, This is what you are to say to Esau when you meet him.

20.verse: And say, Moreover, your servant Jacob is behind us. For he said, I will appease him with the present that goes before me, and afterward I will see his face; perhaps he will accept me.

21.verse: So the present went on before him, and he himself lodged that night in the camp.

22.verse: But he rose up that [same] night and took his two wives, his two women servants, and his eleven sons and passed over the ford [of the] Jabbok.

23.verse: And he took them and sent them across the brook; also he sent over all that he had.

24.verse: And Jacob was left alone, and a Man wrestled with him until daybreak.

25.verse: And when [the Man] saw that He did not prevail against [Jacob], He touched the hollow of his thigh; and Jacob's thigh was put out of joint as he wrestled with Him.

26.verse: Then He said, Let Me go, for day is breaking. But [Jacob] said, I will not let You go unless You declare a blessing upon me.

27.verse: [The Man] asked him, What is your name? And [in shock of realization, whispering] he said, Jacob [supplanter, schemer, trickster, swindler]!

28.verse: And He said, Your name shall be called no more Jacob [supplanter], but Israel [contender with God]; for you have contended and have power with God and with men and have prevailed.

29.verse: Then Jacob asked Him, Tell me, I pray You, what [in contrast] is Your name? But He said, Why is it that you ask My name? And [the Angel of God declared] a blessing on [Jacob] there.

30.verse: And Jacob called the name of the place Peniel [the face of God], saying, For I have seen God face to face, and my life is spared and not snatched away.

31.verse: And as he passed Penuel [Peniel], the sun rose upon him, and he was limping because of his thigh.

32.verse: That is why to this day the Israelites do not eat the sinew of the hip which is on the hollow of the thigh, because [the Angel of the Lord] touched the hollow of Jacob's thigh on the sinew of the hip.

1.verse: AND JACOB raised his eyes and looked, and behold, Esau was coming and with him 400 men. So he divided the children to Leah and to Rachel and to the two maids.

2.verse: And he put the maids and their children in front, Leah and her children after them, and Rachel and Joseph last of all.

3.verse: Then Jacob went over [the stream] before them and bowed himself to the ground seven times, until he came near to his brother.

4.verse: But Esau ran to meet him, and embraced him and fell on his neck and kissed him, and they wept.

5.verse: [Esau] looked up and saw the women and the children and said, Who are these with you? And [Jacob] replied, They are the children whom God has graciously given your servant.

6.verse: Then the maids came near, they and their children, and they bowed themselves.

7.verse: And Leah also with her children came near, and they bowed themselves. After them Joseph and Rachel came near, and they bowed themselves.

8.verse: Esau said, What do you mean by all this company which I met? And he said, These are that I might find favor in the sight of my lord.

9.verse: And Esau said, I have plenty, my brother; keep what you have for yourself.

10.verse: But Jacob replied, No, I beg of you, if now I have found favor in your sight, receive my gift that I am presenting; for truly to see your face is to me as if I had seen the face of God, and you have received me favorably.

11.verse: Accept, I beg of you, my blessing and gift that I have brought to you; for God has dealt graciously with me and I have everything. And he kept urging him and he accepted it.

12.verse: Then [Esau] said, Let us get started on our journey, and I will go before you.

13.verse: But Jacob replied, You know, my lord, that the children are tender and delicate and need gentle care, and the flocks and herds with young are of concern to me; for if the men should overdrive them for a single day, the whole of the flocks would die.

14.verse: Let my lord, I pray you, pass over before his servant; and I will lead on slowly, governed by [consideration for] the livestock that set the pace before me and the endurance of the children, until I come to my lord in Seir.

15.verse: Then Esau said, Let me now leave with you some of the people who are with me. But [Jacob] said, What need is there for it? Let me find favor in the sight of my lord.

16.verse: So Esau turned back that day on his way to Seir.

17.verse: But Jacob journeyed to Succoth and built himself a house and made booths or places of shelter for his livestock; so the name of the place is called Succoth [booths].

18.verse: When Jacob came from Padan-aram, he arrived safely and in peace at the town of Shechem, in the land of Canaan, and pitched his tents before the [enclosed] town.

19.verse: Then he bought the piece of land on which he had encamped from the sons of Hamor, Shechem's father, for a hundred pieces of money.

20.verse: There he erected an altar and called it El-Elohe-Israel [God, the God of Israel].

1.verse: NOW DINAH daughter of Leah, whom she bore to Jacob, went out [unattended] to see the girls of the place.

2.verse: And when Shechem son of Hamor the Hivite, prince of the country, saw her, he seized her, lay with her, and humbled, defiled, and disgraced her.

3.verse: But his soul longed for and clung to Dinah daughter of Jacob, and he loved the girl and spoke comfortingly to her young heart's wishes.

4.verse: And Shechem said to his father Hamor, Get me this girl to be my wife.

5.verse: Jacob heard that [Shechem] had defiled Dinah his daughter. Now his sons were with his livestock in the field. So Jacob held his peace until they came.

6.verse: But Hamor father of Shechem went out to Jacob to have a talk with him.

7.verse: When Jacob's sons heard it, they came from the field; and they were distressed and grieved and very angry, for [Shechem] had done a vile thing to Israel in lying with Jacob's daughter, which ought not to be done.

8.verse: And Hamor conferred with them, saying, The soul of my son Shechem craves your daughter [and sister]. I beg of you give her to him to be his wife.

9.verse: And make marriages with us and give your daughters to us and take our daughters to you.

10.verse: You shall dwell with us; the country will be open to you; live and trade and get your possessions in it.

11.verse: And Shechem said to [Dinah's] father and to her brothers, Let me find favor in your eyes, and I will give you whatever you ask of me.

12.verse: Ask me ever so much dowry and [marriage] gift, and I will give according to what you tell me; only give me the girl to be my wife.

13.verse: The sons of Jacob answered Shechem and Hamor his father deceitfully, [justifying their intended action by saying, in effect, we are going to do this] because Shechem had defiled and disgraced their sister Dinah.

14.verse: They said to them, We cannot do this thing and give our sister to one who is not circumcised, for that would be a reproach and disgrace to us.

15.verse: But we do consent to do this: if you will become as we are and every male among you be circumcised,

16.verse: Then we will give our daughters to you and we will take your daughters to us, and we will dwell with you and become one people.

17.verse: But if you will not listen to us and consent to be circumcised, then we will take our daughter and go.

18.verse: Their words pleased Hamor and his son Shechem.

19.verse: And the young man did not delay to do the thing, for he delighted in Jacob's daughter. He was honored above all his family [so, ranking first, he acted first].

20.verse: Then Hamor and Shechem his son came to the gate of their [enclosed] town and discussed the matter with the citizens, saying,

21.verse: These men are peaceable with us; so let them dwell in the land and trade in it; for the land is large enough [for us and] for them; let us take their daughters for wives and let us give them our daughters.

22.verse: But the men will consent to our request that they live among us and be one people only on condition that every male among us be circumcised, as they are.

23.verse: Shall not their cattle and their possessions and all their beasts be ours? Only let us consent to them, and they will dwell here with us.

24.verse: And all the people who went out of the town gate listened and heeded what Hamor and Shechem said; and every male was circumcised who was a resident of that town.

25.verse: But on the third day [after the circumcision] when [all the men] were sore, two of the sons of Jacob, Simeon and Levi, Dinah's [full] brothers, took their swords, boldly entered the city [without danger], and slew all the males.

26.verse: And they killed Hamor and Shechem his son with the edge of the sword and took Dinah out of Shechem's house [where she had been all this time] and departed.

27.verse: [Then the rest of] Jacob's [eleven] sons came upon the slain and plundered the town, because there their sister had been defiled and disgraced.

28.verse: They took their flocks, their herds, their donkeys, and whatever was in the town and in the field;

29.verse: All their wealth and all their little ones and their wives they took captive, making spoil even of all [they found] in the houses.

30.verse: And Jacob said to Simeon and Levi, You have ruined me, making me infamous and embroiling me with the inhabitants of the land, the Canaanites and the Perizzites! And we are few in number, and they will gather together against me and attack me; and I shall be destroyed, I and my household.

31.verse: And they said, Should he [be permitted to] deal with our sister as with a harlot?

1.verse: AND GOD said to Jacob, Arise, go up to Bethel and dwell there. And make there an altar to God Who appeared to you [in a distinct manifestation] when you fled from the presence of Esau your brother.

2.verse: Then Jacob said to his household and to all who were with him, Put away the [images of] strange gods that are among you, and purify yourselves and change [into fresh] garments;

3.verse: Then let us arise and go up to Bethel, and I will make there an altar to God Who answered me in the day of my distress and was with me wherever I went.

4.verse: So they [both young men and women] gave to Jacob all the strange gods they had and their earrings which were [worn as charms against evil] in their ears; and Jacob buried and hid them under the oak near Shechem.

5.verse: And they journeyed and a terror from God fell on the towns round about them, and they did not pursue the sons of Jacob.

6.verse: So Jacob came to Luz, that is, Bethel, which is in the land of Canaan, he and all the people with him.

7.verse: There he built an altar, and called the place El-bethel [God of Bethel], for there God revealed Himself to him when he fled from the presence of his brother.

8.verse: But Deborah, Rebekah's nurse, died and was buried below Bethel under an oak; and the name of it was called Allon-bacuth [oak of weeping].

9.verse: And God [in a distinctly visible manifestation] appeared to Jacob again when he came out of Padan-aram, and declared a blessing on him.

10.verse: Again God said to him, Your name is Jacob [supplanter]; you shall not be called Jacob any longer, but Israel shall be your name. So He called him Israel [contender with God].

11.verse: And God said to him, I am God Almighty. Be fruitful and multiply; a nation and a company of nations shall come from you and kings shall be born of your stock;

12.verse: The land which I gave Abraham and Isaac I will give to you, and to your descendants after you I will give the land.

13.verse: Then God ascended from him in the place where He talked with him.

14.verse: And Jacob set up a pillar (monument) in the place where he talked with [God], a pillar of stone; and he poured a drink offering on it and he poured oil on it.

15.verse: And Jacob called the name of the place where God had talked with him Bethel [house of God].

16.verse: And they journeyed from Bethel and had but a little way to go to Ephrath [Bethlehem] when Rachel suffered the pangs of childbirth and had hard labor.

17.verse: When she was in hard labor, the midwife said to her, Do not be afraid; you shall have this son also.

18.verse: And as her soul was departing, for she died, she called his name Ben-oni [son of my sorrow]; but his father called him Benjamin [son of the right hand].

19.verse: So Rachel died and was buried on the way to Ephrath, that is, Bethlehem.

20.verse: And Jacob set a pillar (monument) on her grave; that is the pillar of Rachel's grave to this day.

21.verse: Then Israel journeyed on and spread his tent on the other side of the tower of Edar.

22.verse: When Israel dwelt there, Reuben [his eldest son] went and lay with Bilhah his father's concubine; and Israel heard about it. Now Jacob's sons were twelve.

23.verse: The sons of Leah: Reuben, Jacob's firstborn, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, and Zebulun.

24.verse: The sons of Rachel: Joseph and Benjamin.

25.verse: The sons of Bilhah, Rachel's maid: Dan and Naphtali.

26.verse: And the sons of Zilpah, Leah's maid: Gad and Asher. These are the sons of Jacob born to him in Padan-aram.

27.verse: And Jacob came to Isaac his father at Mamre or Kiriath-arba, that is, Hebron, where Abraham and Isaac had sojourned.

28.verse: Now the days of Isaac were 180 years.

29.verse: And Isaac's spirit departed; he died and was gathered to his people, being an old man, satisfied and satiated with days; his sons Esau and Jacob buried him.

1.verse: NOW THIS is the history of the descendants of Esau, that is, Edom.

2.verse: Esau took his wives from the women of Canaan: Adah daughter of Elon the Hittite, and Oholibamah daughter of Anah, the son of Zibeon the Hivite,

3.verse: And Basemath, Ishmael's daughter, sister of Nebaioth.

4.verse: Adah bore to Esau, Eliphaz; Basemath bore Reuel;

5.verse: And Oholibamah bore Jeush, Jalam, and Korah. These are the sons of Esau born to him in Canaan.

6.verse: Now Esau took his wives, his sons, his daughters, and all the members of his household, his cattle, all his beasts, and all his possessions which he had obtained in the land of Canaan, and he went into a land away from his brother Jacob.

7.verse: For their great flocks and herds and possessions [which they had collected] made it impossible for them to dwell together; the land in which they were strangers could not support them because of their livestock.

8.verse: So Esau dwelt in the hill country of Seir; Esau is Edom.

9.verse: And this is the history of the descendants of Esau the father of the Edomites in the hill country of Seir.

10.verse: These are the names of Esau's sons: Eliphaz, the son of Adah, Esau's wife, and Reuel, the son of Basemath, Esau's wife.

11.verse: And the sons of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zepho, Gatam, and Kenaz.

12.verse: And Timna was a concubine of Eliphaz, Esau's son; and she bore Amalek to Eliphaz. These are the sons of Adah, Esau's wife.

13.verse: These are the sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah. These are the sons of Basemath, Esau's wife.

14.verse: And these are the sons of Oholibamah daughter of Anah, the son of Zibeon, Esau's wife. She bore to Esau: Jeush, Jalam, and Korah.

15.verse: These are the chiefs of the sons of Esau: The sons of Eliphaz the firstborn of Esau: Chiefs Teman, Omar, Zepho, Kenaz,

16.verse: Korah, Gatam, and Amalek. These are the chiefs of Eliphaz in the land of Edom; they are the sons of Adah.

17.verse: These are the sons of Reuel, Esau's son: Chiefs Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, Mizzah. These are the chiefs of Reuel in the land of Edom; they are the sons of Basemath, Esau's wife.

18.verse: These are the sons of Oholibamah, Esau's wife: Chiefs Jeush, Jalam, and Korah. These are the chiefs born of Oholibamah daughter of Anah, Esau's wife.

19.verse: These are the sons of Esau, that is, Edom, and these are their chiefs.

20.verse: These are the sons of Seir the Horite, the inhabitants of the land: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah,

21.verse: Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan. These are the chiefs of the Horites, the sons of Seir in the land of Edom.

22.verse: The sons of Lotan are Hori and Hemam; and Lotan's sister is Timna.

23.verse: The sons of Shobal are these: Alvan, Manahath, Ebal, Shepho, and Onam.

24.verse: These are the sons of Zibeon: Aiah and Anah. This is the Anah who found the hot springs in the wilderness as he pastured the donkeys of Zibeon his father.

25.verse: The children of Anah are these: Dishon and Oholibamah daughter of Anah [Esau's wife].

26.verse: These are the sons of Dishon: Hemdan, Eshban, Ithran, and Cheran.

27.verse: Ezer's sons are these: Bilhan, Zaavan, and Akan.

28.verse: The sons of Dishan are these: Uz and Aran.

29.verse: The Horite chiefs are these: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah,

30.verse: Dishon, Ezer, Dishan. These are the Horite chiefs, according to their clans, in the land of Seir.

31.verse: And these are the kings who reigned in Edom before any king reigned over the Israelites:

32.verse: Bela son of Beor reigned in Edom. And the name of his city was Dinhabah.

33.verse: Now Bela died, and Jobab son of Zerah of Bozrah reigned in his stead.

34.verse: Then Jobab died, and Husham of the land of the Temanites reigned in his stead.

35.verse: And Husham died, and Hadad son of Bedad, who defeated Midian in the country of Moab, reigned in his stead. The name of his [enclosed] city was Avith.

36.verse: Hadad died, and Samlah of Masrekah succeeded him.

37.verse: Then Samlah died, and Shaul of Rehoboth on the river [Euphrates] reigned in his stead.

38.verse: And Shaul died, and Baal-hanan son of Achbor reigned in his stead.

39.verse: Baal-hanan son of Achbor died, and then Hadar reigned. His [enclosed] city was Pau; his wife's name was Mehetabel daughter of Matred, the daughter of Mezahab.

40.verse: And these are the names of the chiefs of Esau, according to their families and places of residence, by their names: Chiefs Timna, Alvah, Jetheth,

43.verse: Magdiel, and Iram. These are the chiefs of Edom [that is, of Esau the father of the Edomites], according to their dwelling places in their land.

1.verse: SO JACOB dwelt in the land in which his father had been a stranger and sojourner, in the land of Canaan.

2.verse: This is the history of the descendants of Jacob and this is Jacob's line. Joseph, when he was seventeen years old, was shepherding the flock with his brothers; the lad was with the sons of Bilhah and Zilpah, his father's [secondary] wives; and Joseph brought to his father a bad report of them.

3.verse: Now Israel loved Joseph more than all his children because he was the son of his old age, and he made him a [distinctive] long tunic with sleeves.

4.verse: But when his brothers saw that their father loved [Joseph] more than all of his brothers, they hated him and could not say, Peace [in friendly greeting] to him or speak peaceably to him.

5.verse: Now Joseph had a dream and he told it to his brothers, and they hated him still more.

6.verse: And he said to them, Listen now and hear, I pray you, this dream that I have dreamed:

7.verse: We [brothers] were binding sheaves in the field, and behold, my sheaf arose and stood upright, and behold, your sheaves stood round about my sheaf and bowed down!

8.verse: His brothers said to him, Shall you indeed reign over us? Or are you going to have us as your subjects and dominate us? And they hated him all the more for his dreams and for what he said.

9.verse: But Joseph dreamed yet another dream and told it to his brothers [also]. He said, See here, I have dreamed again, and behold, [this time not only] eleven stars [but also] the sun and the moon bowed down and did reverence to me!

10.verse: And he told it to his father [as well as] his brethren. But his father rebuked him and said to him, What is the meaning of this dream that you have dreamed? Shall I and your mother and your brothers actually come to bow down ourselves to the earth and do homage to you?

11.verse: Joseph's brothers envied him and were jealous of him, but his father observed the saying and pondered over it.

12.verse: Joseph's brothers went to shepherd and feed their father's flock near Shechem.

13.verse: [One day] Israel said to Joseph, Do not your brothers shepherd my flock at Shechem? Come, and I will send you to them. And he said, Here I am.

14.verse: And [Jacob] said to him, Go, I pray you, see whether everything is all right with your brothers and with the flock; then come back and bring me word. So he sent him out of the Hebron Valley, and he came to Shechem.

15.verse: And a certain man found him, and behold, he had lost his way and was wandering in the open country. The man asked him, What are you trying to find?

16.verse: And he said, I am looking for my brothers. Tell me, I pray you, where they are pasturing our flocks.

17.verse: But the man said, [They were here, but] they have gone. I heard them say, Let us go to Dothan. And Joseph went after his brothers and found them at Dothan.

18.verse: And when they saw him far off, even before he came near to them, they conspired to kill him.

19.verse: And they said one to another, See, here comes this dreamer and master of dreams.

20.verse: So come on now, let us kill him and throw his body into some pit; then we will say [to our father], Some wild and ferocious animal has devoured him; and we shall see what will become of his dreams!

21.verse: Now Reuben heard it and he delivered him out of their hands by saying, Let us not kill him.

22.verse: And Reuben said to them, Shed no blood, but cast him into this pit or well that is out here in the wilderness and lay no hand on him. He was trying to get Joseph out of their hands in order to rescue him and deliver him again to his father.

23.verse: When Joseph had come to his brothers, they stripped him of his [distinctive] long garment which he was wearing;

24.verse: Then they took him and cast him into the [well-like] pit which was empty; there was no water in it.

25.verse: Then they sat down to eat their lunch. When they looked up, behold, they saw a caravan of Ishmaelites [mixed Arabians] coming from Gilead, with their camels bearing gum [of the styrax tree], balm (balsam), and myrrh or ladanum, going on their way to carry them down to Egypt.

26.verse: And Judah said to his brothers, What do we gain if we slay our brother and conceal his blood?

27.verse: Come, let us sell him to the Ishmaelites [and Midianites, these mixed Arabians who are approaching], and let not our hand be upon him, for he is our brother and our flesh. And his brothers consented.

28.verse: Then as the Midianite [and Ishmaelite] merchants were passing by, the brothers pulled Joseph up and lifted him out of the well. And they sold him for twenty pieces of silver to the Ishmaelites, who took Joseph [captive] into Egypt.

29.verse: Then Reuben [who had not been there when the brothers plotted to sell the lad] returned to the pit; and behold, Joseph was not in the pit, and he rent his clothes.

30.verse: He rejoined his brothers and said, The boy is not there! And I, where shall I go [to hide from my father]?

31.verse: Then they took Joseph's [distinctive] long garment, killed a young goat, and dipped the garment in the blood;

32.verse: And they sent the garment to their father, saying, We have found this! Examine and decide whether it is your son's tunic or not.

33.verse: He said, My son's long garment! An evil [wild] beast has devoured him; Joseph is without doubt rent in pieces.

34.verse: And Jacob tore his clothes, put on sackcloth, and mourned many days for his son.

35.verse: And all his sons and daughters attempted to console him, but he refused to be comforted and said, I will go down to Sheol (the place of the dead) to my son mourning. And his father wept for him.

36.verse: And the Midianites [and Ishmaelites] sold [Joseph] in Egypt to Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh and the captain and chief executioner of the [royal] guard.

1.verse: AT THAT time Judah withdrew from his brothers and went to [lodge with] a certain Adullamite named Hirah.

2.verse: There Judah saw and met a daughter of Shuah, a Canaanite; he took her as wife and lived with her.

3.verse: And she became pregnant and bore a son, and he called him Er.
